News Pictures released of separate horror crashes which killed two baseball stars in tragic coincidence WARNING GRAPHIC IMAGES: MLB stars Yordano Ventura and Andy Marte both died in the Dominican Republic within hours of each other Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Major league baseball player Yordano Ventura killed in car crashes Share this video Get   
Pictures have been released showing the horrific aftermath of two car crashes which killed two major league American baseball players within hours in the SAME foreign country. 
In what appears to be a sickening coincidence, Yordano Ventura of the Kansas City Royals and former Cleveland Indians player Andy Marte both died in the Dominican Republic in the early hours of Sunday morning . 
Both are thought to have been travelling on their own in separate vehicles when the accidents happened just a few hours apart. 
Fearless right-hander Yordano Ventura - who played a crucial role steering Kansas City Royals to victory - was killed in a car accident in his native Dominican Republic on Sunday. Read More Yordano Ventura was killed in a crash (Photo: REUTERS) Police released harrowing pictures of the crash scene (Photo: @Jacobommoquete/twitter) 
Ventura, 25, was killed on the Juan Adrián highway in San Jose de Ocoa. 
The crash was confirmed by Colonel Jacobo Mateo Moquete, a spokesman for the Dominican Republic military and police. Ventura's vehicle flipped onto its side (Photo: @Jacobommoquete/twitter) Bystanders at the scene of the crash (Photo: @Jacobommoquete/twitter) Firefighters douse flames at the scene (Photo: @Jacobommoquete/twitter) 
Moquete posted graphic pictures of the crash scene on his Twitter account hours after the accident. 
He added that Ventura was the sole passenger in the vehicle. Tributes have been left to Ventura Kansas City Chiefs fans gathered to mourn their player Shirts were left in tribute to the tragic player 
In a statement on the team website, Royals vice president of communications and broadcasting Mike Swanson said: "It is with a heavy and broken heart that we confirm the passing of Yordano Ventura." Yordano Ventura at bat (Photo: Rex Features) Ventura throws a pitch against the New York Mets (Photo: REUTERS) 
Meanwhile, in a separate incident on Sunday, former MLB third baseman Marte, once one of the best prospects in baseball, was also killed in a crash in his native Dominican Republic. 
Early reports also indicate the 33-year-old was traveling alone in his vehicle when the accident occurred. Andy Marte has also died in a separate car crash on the same day (Photo: Rex Features) Marte's vehicle was destroyed in the crash The pair died within hours of each other 
The news was later confirmed by his agent via Twitter. 
Paying tribute to the players, MLB commissioner Rob Manfred said:"Today is a very sad day for our entire game and particularly for the many loyal fans in the Dominican Republic, the home of both Yordano Ventura and Andy Marte. 
"Yordano was a key figure in the Royals' recent success. His electric talent on the mound helped lead the Royals to two American League pennants and the 2015 world championship. Marte's death comes two years after another crash in the Dominican Republic killed a promising young baseball player (Photo: Rex Features) Marte is also believed to have been travelling on his own in a car (Photo: Rex Features) 
"Andy was a respected member of six organizations who played seven Major League seasons, including for the Cleveland Indians from 2006-2010." 
Ventura had spent his entire major league career in Kansas City, helping the Royals to a World Series title in 2015 and posting a 13-8 record. 
The right-hander, who signed with Kansas City as an amateur free agent in 2008, established himself as a future ace by going 14-10 in his rookie season and finishing sixth in the 2014 American League Rookie of the Year Award voting. Ventura started 93 games in his career with the Royals (Photo: Rex Features) 
Both their deaths come just over two years after another very promising young player, outfielder Oscar Taveras, 24, was killed in a car accident in the Dominican Republic. 
Taveras and his girlfriend died in Puerto Plata in October 26. Read More
